awd_titl_txt: II-NEW: WiNEST: A Prototype for a City-scale "Living Laboratory" for Wide-area Wireless Experimentation
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The primary goal of this project has been to design and operate a research-oriented, infrastructure for wireless networking. The project explored the deployment of a number of resources that provide wide area coverage through WiMAX and LTE base stations (commonly used wireless technologies today), edge computing capabilities, and mobile sensing provided by vehicle-mounted devices. By deploying such experimental infrastructure, researchers are enabled to try new experiments that explore innovative use of wireless systems, such as for smart transportation, wide-area environmental sensing, and more.

Some of the specific tasks undertaken include:

1. Set up multiple cellular base stations. Each base station was configured to allow flow-level control of traffic right at the network’s edge. The sites very selected based on roof-top access available across different vantage points. A key aspect of the deployment is to complete the various cabling and network connectivity issues for this infrastructure. Experimental FCC spectrum licenses for these sites were used to operate the infrastructure.

2. Design edge computing Wi-Fi gateways. Throughout the course of the project, we deployed a number of wireless gateways that facilitate edge computing functions. Some of these gateways connect to the wide area through our cellular infrastructure described above. Others have a wired connection and contribute to our distributed computing infrastructure.

3. Develop a knowledgebase and process to manage the deployment. We finally established a blueprint of a mechanism through which the above infrastructure is designed, stress tested, and deployed. The process included appropriate appropriate monitoring and control functions at all levels.

 


Last Modified: 01/01/2022
Modified by: Suman Banerjee
